fields_of_interest: Education and training, Environment, Trans-European Networks
eu_initiatives:
Tous les dossiers, directives, initiatives concernant les animaux et leur bien-être. 
En particulier : 
Stratégie de l'UE pour la protection et le bien-être des animaux (2012-2015). 
Enquête 2014 de la Commission Européenne sur les animaux de compagnie et les animaux errants (résultats en attente).
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
subsection: Transnational associations and networks of public regional or other sub-national authorities

goals__remit:
French association under 1901 non profit law. We gather under the charter Galgos Ethics Europe european organizations whose aim is to work with a guideline: 
protecting animals as sentient beings is also protecting children. 
Our actions follow three axes: 
 
GALGOS: Spanish Greyhounds, 50,000 tortured, abandoned, killed each year after hunting. No pet status and no real legal protection. They are the symbol of animal abuse in Europe and non compliance with animal protection laws.  
 
ETHICS: Philosophical practice and normative rules in a natural and human environment. 
 
EUROPE: All countries of the European Union. 
 
Main objectives: 
 
1.the primacy of the concept "animal as a sentient being" wherever traditions, cultures, customs, festivals, performances include pain, torture and death of an animal. 
 
2.The creation of a Ministry of Animals and Animal Protection in european countries. 
 
3. The recognition in Spain  of the status of greyhounds (galgos, Podencos, Pharaos) as pets, domestic animals, with the creation of a specific legislation. According to Spanish protection associations, 50,000 galgos are tortured, thrown down in a well, left attached  till death every year at the end of the hunting season. No actual law of animal protection is applied. Several complaints were presented to the European Commission without actual result up to now from the member state. 
 
4. The creation of a regular European Commission survey on the status of pets and other animals across Europe. 
 
5. The creation of school and university programs to promote respect for life, the concept of "animal as a sentient being » and ethics involved in the interest of respect,  well-being and balance of children.
